trans-unit.source: How to use Notification Hubs with Node.js
trans-unit.target: How to use Notification Hubs with Node.js

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Notification Hubs to send push notifications from a Node.js application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Notification Hubs to send push notifications from a Node.js application.

trans-unit.source: How to use Notification Hubs from Node.js
trans-unit.target: How to use Notification Hubs from Node.js

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide will show you how to use Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: This guide will show you how to use Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: from Node.js applications.
trans-unit.target: from Node.js applications.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include sending notifications to Android, iOS, Windows Phone and Windows Store applications.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include sending notifications to Android, iOS, Windows Phone and Windows Store applications.

trans-unit.source: For more information on notification hubs, see the <link><linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title></link> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on notification hubs, see the <link><linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title></link> section.

trans-unit.source: What are Notification Hubs?
trans-unit.target: What are Notification Hubs?

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs provide an easy-to-use, multiplatform, scalable infrastructure for sending push notifications to mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs provide an easy-to-use, multiplatform, scalable infrastructure for sending push notifications to mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Notification Hubs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Notification Hubs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create a Node.js Application
trans-unit.target: Create a Node.js Application

trans-unit.source: Create a blank Node.js application.
trans-unit.target: Create a blank Node.js application.

trans-unit.source: For instructions creating a Node.js application, see <link><linkText>Create and deploy a Node.js application to Azure Web Site[nodejswebsite]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Node.js Cloud Service[node.js cloud service]</linkText><title></title></link> (using Windows PowerShell), or [Web Site with WebMatrix].
trans-unit.target: For instructions creating a Node.js application, see <link><linkText>Create and deploy a Node.js application to Azure Web Site[nodejswebsite]</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Node.js Cloud Service[node.js cloud service]</linkText><title></title></link> (using Windows PowerShell), or [Web Site with WebMatrix].

trans-unit.source: Configure Your Application to Use Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Configure Your Application to Use Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Notification Hub, you need to download and use the
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Notification Hub, you need to download and use the

trans-unit.source: Node.js azure package.
trans-unit.target: Node.js azure package.

trans-unit.source: This includes a set of convenience libraries that
trans-unit.target: This includes a set of convenience libraries that

trans-unit.source: communicate with the REST services.
trans-unit.target: communicate with the REST services.

trans-unit.source: Use Node Package Manager (NPM) to obtain the package
trans-unit.target: Use Node Package Manager (NPM) to obtain the package

trans-unit.source: Use a command-line interface such as PowerShell (Windows,) Terminal (Mac,) or Bash (Unix), navigate to the folder where you created your sample application.
trans-unit.target: Use a command-line interface such as PowerShell (Windows,) Terminal (Mac,) or Bash (Unix), navigate to the folder where you created your sample application.

trans-unit.source: Type npm install azure in the command window, which should
trans-unit.target: Type npm install azure in the command window, which should

trans-unit.target: result in the following output:

trans-unit.target: You can manually run the ls or dir command to verify that a

trans-unit.target: node\_modules folder was created.

trans-unit.target: Inside that folder find the

trans-unit.source: Setup an Azure Notification Hub connection
trans-unit.target: Setup an Azure Notification Hub connection

trans-unit.source: The NotificationHubService object lets you work with notification hubs.
trans-unit.target: The NotificationHubService object lets you work with notification hubs.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: following code creates a NotificationHubService object for the nofication hub named hubname.
trans-unit.target: following code creates a NotificationHubService object for the nofication hub named hubname.

trans-unit.source: Add it near the
trans-unit.target: Add it near the

trans-unit.source: top of the server.js file, after the statement to import the azure
trans-unit.target: top of the server.js file, after the statement to import the azure

trans-unit.source: module:
trans-unit.target: module:

trans-unit.source: The connection connectionstring value can be obtained from the Azure Management portal by performing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: The connection connectionstring value can be obtained from the Azure Management portal by performing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Management portal, select Service Bus, and then select the namespace that contains the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Management portal, select Service Bus, and then select the namespace that contains the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Select NOTIFICATION HUBS, and then select the hub you wish to use.
trans-unit.target: Select NOTIFICATION HUBS, and then select the hub you wish to use.

trans-unit.source: Select View Connection String from the quick glance section, and copy the connection string value.
trans-unit.target: Select View Connection String from the quick glance section, and copy the connection string value.

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve the connection string using the Get-AzureSbNamespace cmdlet provided by Azure PowerShell or the azure sb namespace show command with the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve the connection string using the Get-AzureSbNamespace cmdlet provided by Azure PowerShell or the azure sb namespace show command with the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).

trans-unit.source: How to send notifications
trans-unit.target: How to send notifications

trans-unit.source: The NotificationHubService object exposes the following object instances for sending notifications to specific devices and applications:
trans-unit.target: The NotificationHubService object exposes the following object instances for sending notifications to specific devices and applications:

trans-unit.source: Android - use the GcmService object, which is available at notificationHubService.gcm
trans-unit.target: Android - use the GcmService object, which is available at notificationHubService.gcm

trans-unit.source: iOS - use the ApnsService object, which is accessible at notificationHubService.apns
trans-unit.target: iOS - use the ApnsService object, which is accessible at notificationHubService.apns

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone - use the MpnsService object, which is available at notificationHubService.mpns
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone - use the MpnsService object, which is available at notificationHubService.mpns

trans-unit.source: Windows Store applications - use the WnsService object, which is available at notificationHubService.wns
trans-unit.target: Windows Store applications - use the WnsService object, which is available at notificationHubService.wns

trans-unit.source: How to send Android application notifications
trans-unit.target: How to send Android application notifications

trans-unit.source: The GcmService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Android applications.
trans-unit.target: The GcmService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Android applications.

trans-unit.source: The send method accepts the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: The send method accepts the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Tags - the tag identifier.
trans-unit.target: Tags - the tag identifier.

trans-unit.source: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to al clients
trans-unit.target: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to al clients

trans-unit.source: Payload - the message's JSON or string payload
trans-unit.target: Payload - the message's JSON or string payload

trans-unit.source: Callback - the callback function
trans-unit.target: Callback - the callback function

trans-unit.source: For more information on the payload format, see the Payload section of <link><linkText>Implementing GCM Server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the payload format, see the Payload section of <link><linkText>Implementing GCM Server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses the GcmService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send a message to all clients.
trans-unit.target: The following code uses the GcmService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send a message to all clients.

trans-unit.source: How to send iOS application notifications
trans-unit.target: How to send iOS application notifications

trans-unit.source: The ApnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to iOS applications.
trans-unit.target: The ApnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to iOS applications.

trans-unit.source: The send method accepts the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: The send method accepts the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Tags - the tag identifier.
trans-unit.target: Tags - the tag identifier.

trans-unit.source: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients
trans-unit.target: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients

trans-unit.source: Payload - the message's JSON or string payload
trans-unit.target: Payload - the message's JSON or string payload

trans-unit.source: Callback - the callback function
trans-unit.target: Callback - the callback function

trans-unit.source: For more information the payload format, see The Notification Payload section of the <link><linkText>Local and Push Notification Programming Guide</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information the payload format, see The Notification Payload section of the <link><linkText>Local and Push Notification Programming Guide</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses the ApnsService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send an alert message to all clients:
trans-unit.target: The following code uses the ApnsService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send an alert message to all clients:

trans-unit.source: How to send Windows Phone notifications
trans-unit.target: How to send Windows Phone notifications

trans-unit.source: The MpnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Windows Phone applications.
trans-unit.target: The MpnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Windows Phone applications.

trans-unit.source: The send method accepts the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: The send method accepts the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Tags - the tag identifier.
trans-unit.target: Tags - the tag identifier.

trans-unit.source: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients
trans-unit.target: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients

trans-unit.source: Payload - the message's XML payload
trans-unit.target: Payload - the message's XML payload

trans-unit.source: TargetName - 'toast' for toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: TargetName - 'toast' for toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: 'token' for tile notifications.
trans-unit.target: 'token' for tile notifications.

trans-unit.source: NotificationClass - The priority of the notification.
trans-unit.target: NotificationClass - The priority of the notification.

trans-unit.source: See the HTTP Header Elements section of <link><linkText>Push notifications from a server</linkText><title></title></link> for valid values.
trans-unit.target: See the HTTP Header Elements section of <link><linkText>Push notifications from a server</linkText><title></title></link> for valid values.

trans-unit.source: Options - optional request headers
trans-unit.target: Options - optional request headers

trans-unit.source: Callback - the callback function
trans-unit.target: Callback - the callback function

trans-unit.source: For a list of valid TargetName, NotificationClass, and header options, see <link><linkText>Push notifications from a server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of valid TargetName, NotificationClass, and header options, see <link><linkText>Push notifications from a server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following code uses the MpnsService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send a toast alert:
trans-unit.target: The following code uses the MpnsService instance exposed by the NotificationHubService to send a toast alert:

trans-unit.source: How to send Windows Store application notifications
trans-unit.target: How to send Windows Store application notifications

trans-unit.source: The WnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Windows Store applications.
trans-unit.target: The WnsService object provides a send method that can be used to send notifications to Windows Store applications.

trans-unit.source: The send method accepts the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: The send method accepts the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Tags - the tag identifier.
trans-unit.target: Tags - the tag identifier.

trans-unit.source: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients
trans-unit.target: If no tag is provided, the notification will be sent to all clients

trans-unit.source: Payload - the XML message payload
trans-unit.target: Payload - the XML message payload

trans-unit.source: Type - the notification type
trans-unit.target: Type - the notification type

trans-unit.source: Options - optional request headers
trans-unit.target: Options - optional request headers

trans-unit.source: Callback - the callback function
trans-unit.target: Callback - the callback function

trans-unit.source: For a list of valid Types and request headers, see <link><linkText>Push notification service request and response headers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of valid Types and request headers, see <link><linkText>Push notification service request and response headers</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: links to learn more.

trans-unit.target: See the MSDN Reference: <link><linkText>Azure Notification Hubs[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
